alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Wichita, southeastern Wallace and northeastern Greeley Counties through 500 PM MDT/600 PM CDT/... At 428 PM MDT/528 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Weskan to 9 miles northwest of Leoti. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wichita, southeastern Wallace and northeastern Greeley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
